oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Tom T. Hall Interview by Bob Allen 1-15-82 - Tape Two, Side Two
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is an interview of Tom T. Hall by Bob Allen. The interview takes place on 1-15-82.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Tom T. Hall;
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Tape Two, Side Two - (0:07) -- Bob Allen asks Tom T. Hall whether he still wishes that he "devoted his life to a higher cause." Tom T. Hall and Bob Allen discuss the subject of setting your life goals. Tom T. Hall mentions that some of his friends are "too smart to be a country music entertainer." (4:03) -- Bob Allen asks Tom T. Hall's feelings about identifying as an entertainer. Tom T. Hall speaks about being startled by being widely known and recognized. (8:12) -- Bob Allen discusses his opinion that good art will often contradict itself. (11:16) -- Bob Allen asks Tom T. Hall about his previous marriage (after the army). (11:45) -- Bob Allen asks Tom T. Hall about the timeline of a few songs. Tom T. Hall mentions that he wrote "Ballad Of Forty Dollars," "Homecoming," and "Harper Valley PTA" in one day. (12:27) -- Tom T. Hall mentions a favorite song of his named "Shame On The Rain." (13:35) -- Discussion about the song "That's How I Got To Memphis." Bob Allen continues discussion about Tom T. Hall's unique nature of objectively telling an emotional story. (16:58) -- Tom T. Hall describes the best compliment a songwriter can receive. (18:49) -- Tom T. Hall mentions his friendship with Kurt Vonnegut and his brilliant writing. (19:45) -- Tom T. Hall mentions that he loves the compliment "that sounds like a Tom T. Hall song." (20:13) -- Bob Allen asks Tom T. Hall about writing the song "I'm Not Ready Yet" for George Jones. (22:24) -- Tom T. Hall speaks about his song "That's How I Got To Memphis." Bob Allen asks about Bobby Bare recording "That's How I Got To Memphis." (27:10) -- Bob Allen asks about a song recorded by Tom T. Hall "Soldier Of Fortune." Tom T. Hall didn't write this song. (28:40) -- Bob Allen asks Tom T. Hall about nostalgia in his songwriting. (30:54) -- Tom T. Hall discusses the powerful imagery of his song "Strawberry Farms." (33:05) -- Tom T. Hall reflects on his life's decisions. (36:40) -- Bob Allen asks Tom T. Hall about his song "I Hope It Rains At My Funeral." (38:57) -- "I've always loved women and the English language and I've never understood either one of them" - Tom T. Hall.
